storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my daily work schedule to plan my workday effectively

testCases.title: Validate daily schedule display with valid employee and date
preconditions: Employee account exists in the system with valid credentials
Employee has at least one shift scheduled for today and previous day
Scheduling portal is accessible and operational
Test data includes shift times, locations, and role information
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling portal login page using a web browser
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials (username and password) and click 'Login' button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify that the dashboard is displayed with navigation options
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard is displayed showing menu options including 'Daily View' and 'Weekly View'

steps.action: Click on 'Daily View' option from the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: System navigates to the daily schedule view and displays today's date as the default selected date

steps.action: Review the displayed schedule information for today
steps.expectedResult: Schedule for today is displayed showing shift start time, end time, location, and role assignment. Current day is highlighted for easy recognition

steps.action: Verify that all shift details are accurate and match the expected schedule data
steps.expectedResult: All shift information is correct, complete, and clearly formatted

steps.action: Click on the 'Previous Day' navigation button or arrow
steps.expectedResult: System loads and displays the schedule for the previous day within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify the previous day's schedule details
steps.expectedResult: Schedule for previous day is displayed correctly with accurate shift times, location, and role information

steps.action: Click on the 'Next Day' navigation button to return to today
steps.expectedResult: System navigates back to today's schedule and displays it correctly

postconditions: Employee remains logged into the system
Daily schedule view is displayed
No errors are logged in the system
Session remains active

testCases.title: Verify access restriction to other employees' schedules
preconditions: Two employee accounts exist in the system (Employee A and Employee B)
Employee A is logged into the scheduling portal
Employee B has schedule data available in the system
Role-based access control is configured and active
OAuth2 authentication is enabled

steps.action: Log into the scheduling portal as Employee A using valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Employee A is successfully authenticated and dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to the daily schedule view for Employee A
steps.expectedResult: Employee A's daily schedule is displayed correctly

steps.action: Note the current URL structure in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: URL contains Employee A's employee ID parameter (e.g., /api/schedules/daily?employeeId=A&date=today)

steps.action: Manually modify the URL by changing the employeeId parameter to Employee B's ID
steps.expectedResult: URL is updated in the address bar

steps.action: Press Enter to attempt to load Employee B's schedule
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied and an appropriate error message is displayed (e.g., 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view this schedule' or HTTP 403 Forbidden)

steps.action: Verify that no schedule data for Employee B is visible on the screen
steps.expectedResult: No unauthorized schedule information is displayed to Employee A

steps.action: Navigate back to Employee A's own daily schedule using the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: System redirects to Employee A's schedule view

steps.action: Verify that Employee A's schedule is displayed correctly
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is displayed without errors, showing correct shift details for Employee A

postconditions: Employee A remains logged in with access only to their own schedule
Security logs record the unauthorized access attempt
No data breach occurred
System maintains proper access control

Employee has schedule data for today and tomorrow
Mobile device (smartphone or tablet) is available for testing

steps.action: Tap on 'Daily View' option from the mobile navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Daily schedule view loads and displays correctly on the mobile screen

steps.action: Verify the layout and readability of the schedule on the mobile device
steps.expectedResult: Schedule displays correctly with no layout issues, text is readable, shift details are clearly visible, and no horizontal scrolling is required

steps.action: Check that all schedule elements (shift times, location, role) are properly formatted for mobile view
steps.expectedResult: All schedule information is properly sized and positioned for mobile display with appropriate touch targets

steps.action: Tap on the 'Next Day' navigation button
steps.expectedResult: Navigation works smoothly without lag or errors

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my weekly work schedule to plan my week ahead

Employee has shifts scheduled for current week and next week
Scheduling portal is accessible and operational
Test data includes multiple shifts across the week with times, locations, and roles
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling portal login page using a web browser
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password input fields

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials (username and password) and click 'Login' button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard within 3 seconds

steps.action: Verify that the dashboard is displayed with available navigation options
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard is displayed showing menu options including 'Daily View' and 'Weekly View'

steps.action: Click on 'Weekly View' option from the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: System navigates to the weekly schedule view and displays the current week by default

steps.action: Verify that the weekly schedule is displayed in calendar format
steps.expectedResult: Schedule for the current week is displayed in a calendar layout showing all seven days (or work days) of the week

steps.action: Review all shifts displayed for the current week
steps.expectedResult: All shifts for the week are shown with correct shift start times, end times, locations, and role assignments. Current week is highlighted for easy recognition

steps.action: Verify that each day's shifts are clearly organized and readable
steps.expectedResult: Shifts are properly organized by day with clear visual separation and all details are accurate

steps.action: Click on the 'Next Week' navigation button or arrow
steps.expectedResult: System loads and displays the schedule for the next week within 3 seconds

steps.action: Verify the next week's schedule details
steps.expectedResult: Schedule for next week is displayed correctly with accurate shift information for all scheduled days

steps.action: Verify that the week indicator updates to show the correct week range
steps.expectedResult: Week header or indicator shows the correct date range for next week (e.g., 'Week of Jan 15-21, 2024')

steps.action: Click on the 'Previous Week' navigation button to return to current week
steps.expectedResult: System navigates back to the current week and displays the schedule correctly

postconditions: Employee remains logged into the system
Weekly schedule view is displayed
No errors are logged in the system
Session remains active

testCases.title: Verify access restriction to other employees' weekly schedules
preconditions: Two employee accounts exist in the system (Employee A and Employee B)
Employee A is logged into the scheduling portal
Employee B has weekly schedule data available in the system
Role-based access control is configured and active
OAuth2 authentication is enabled

steps.action: Log into the scheduling portal as Employee A using valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Employee A is successfully authenticated and dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to the weekly schedule view for Employee A
steps.expectedResult: Employee A's weekly schedule is displayed correctly in calendar format

steps.action: Note the current URL structure in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: URL contains Employee A's employee ID parameter (e.g., /api/schedules/weekly?employeeId=A&weekStart=2024-01-15)

steps.action: Manually modify the URL by changing the employeeId parameter to Employee B's ID while keeping the same week
steps.expectedResult: URL is updated in the address bar with Employee B's ID

steps.action: Press Enter to attempt to load Employee B's weekly schedule
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied and an appropriate error message is displayed (e.g., 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view this schedule' or HTTP 403 Forbidden)

steps.action: Verify that no schedule data for Employee B is visible on the screen
steps.expectedResult: No unauthorized weekly schedule information is displayed to Employee A

steps.action: Navigate back to Employee A's own weekly schedule using the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: System redirects to Employee A's weekly schedule view

steps.action: Verify that Employee A's weekly schedule is displayed correctly
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is displayed without errors, showing correct shift details for Employee A across the week

postconditions: Employee A remains logged in with access only to their own schedule
Security logs record the unauthorized access attempt
No data breach occurred
System maintains proper access control

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to navigate between past and future schedules to review my work history and upcoming shifts

testCases.title: Validate schedule navigation between dates
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has access to the schedule interface
Schedule data exists for past, current, and future dates
Employee is viewing the current schedule page
Navigation controls (Next Day, Previous Day, Next Week, Previous Week buttons) are visible

steps.action: Verify the current date is displayed on the schedule interface
steps.expectedResult: Current date is clearly shown in the schedule header

steps.action: Note the shifts displayed for the current day
steps.expectedResult: Current day's shifts are visible with shift times, locations, and details

steps.action: Click the 'Next Day' button
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates to display the next day's shifts within 2 seconds, date header updates to show next day's date, and shifts for the next day are displayed correctly

steps.action: Verify the schedule content has changed to the next day
steps.expectedResult: Different shifts are displayed corresponding to the next day, and the date indicator reflects the new date

steps.action: Click the 'Previous Week' button
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates to display the previous week's shifts within 2 seconds, date range updates to show the previous week, and all shifts for that week are displayed correctly

steps.action: Verify the schedule content has changed to the previous week
steps.expectedResult: Shifts from the previous week are displayed with correct dates, times, and details

steps.action: Click the 'Next Week' button twice to navigate forward
steps.expectedResult: Schedule advances two weeks forward, displaying future shifts accurately with updated date range

steps.action: Click the 'Previous Day' button
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates to display the previous day's shifts within 2 seconds, date updates accordingly, and correct shifts are shown

postconditions: Employee remains logged in
Schedule interface is still functional
Navigation controls remain available for further use
No errors are displayed on the interface
System maintains session state

testCases.title: Verify filter persistence during navigation
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has access to the schedule interface
Schedule data exists with multiple shift types (e.g., Morning, Evening, Night)
Employee is viewing the current schedule page
Filter controls are visible and functional
Navigation controls are visible and functional

steps.action: Verify the schedule displays all shift types without any filters applied
steps.expectedResult: All shifts are visible including Morning, Evening, Night, and other shift types

steps.action: Locate and click on the shift type filter dropdown or control
steps.expectedResult: Filter options are displayed showing available shift types (Morning, Evening, Night, etc.)

steps.action: Select 'Morning' shift type from the filter options
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates to display only Morning shifts, other shift types are hidden, and filter indicator shows 'Morning' is selected

steps.action: Verify only Morning shifts are displayed on the current schedule
steps.expectedResult: Only shifts labeled as 'Morning' are visible, and the count of displayed shifts matches the number of Morning shifts

steps.action: Click the 'Next Day' button to navigate to the next day
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates to the next day within 2 seconds, Morning filter remains applied (indicated in filter control), and only Morning shifts for the next day are displayed

steps.action: Verify the filter is still active and only Morning shifts are shown for the new date
steps.expectedResult: Filter indicator still shows 'Morning' selected, only Morning shifts are visible, and Evening/Night shifts are not displayed

steps.action: Click the 'Next Week' button to navigate to the next week
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates to the next week within 2 seconds, Morning filter remains applied, and only Morning shifts for the next week are displayed

steps.action: Verify the filter persistence across week navigation
steps.expectedResult: Filter indicator continues to show 'Morning' selected, only Morning shifts are visible for the entire week, and filter has not been reset

steps.action: Click the 'Previous Day' button to navigate backward
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates to the previous day, Morning filter remains applied, and only Morning shifts are displayed

steps.action: Clear the filter by deselecting 'Morning' or clicking 'Clear Filter'
steps.expectedResult: All shift types are now displayed for the current date, and filter indicator shows no active filters

postconditions: Employee remains logged in
Schedule interface is functional
Filter can be reapplied or modified
Navigation controls remain functional
No errors are displayed
System state is consistent

storyTitle: As Employee, I want the schedule interface to be responsive to use on mobile devices for convenience

testCases.title: Validate responsive layout on various screen sizes
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials
Schedule data is available in the system
Test devices or browser developer tools are available for testing (desktop, tablet, mobile)
Internet connection is stable
Browsers are updated to latest versions (Chrome, Safari, Firefox, Edge)

steps.action: Open a desktop browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, or Edge) and navigate to the schedule interface login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page loads successfully and displays correctly on desktop screen

steps.action: Log in with valid employee credentials on desktop browser
steps.expectedResult: Login is successful and schedule interface is displayed

steps.action: Verify the desktop layout displays all schedule features including navigation controls, filters, search, and full schedule grid
steps.expectedResult: All features are visible and properly arranged, schedule grid shows multiple columns, navigation controls are clearly visible, filters and search are accessible, and layout utilizes full screen width appropriately

steps.action: Verify all interactive elements (buttons, dropdowns, links) are clickable and properly sized for desktop use
steps.expectedResult: All controls are easily clickable with mouse, hover states work correctly, and elements are appropriately spaced

steps.action: Open a tablet device (iPad, Android tablet) or resize browser window to tablet dimensions (768px - 1024px width)
steps.expectedResult: Browser window resizes or tablet browser opens successfully

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule interface and log in on tablet
steps.expectedResult: Login page is responsive and usable on tablet, login is successful, and schedule interface loads

steps.action: Verify the tablet layout adjusts appropriately with readable text, accessible controls, and optimized schedule grid
steps.expectedResult: Layout adapts to tablet screen size, schedule grid may show fewer columns but remains readable, navigation controls are touch-friendly and properly sized, filters and search remain accessible, and no horizontal scrolling is required for main content

steps.action: Test scrolling behavior on tablet view
steps.expectedResult: Vertical scrolling works smoothly, content is not cut off, and headers remain visible or accessible during scroll

steps.action: Open a mobile device (iPhone, Android phone) or resize browser window to mobile dimensions (320px - 480px width)
steps.expectedResult: Browser window resizes or mobile browser opens successfully

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule interface and log in on mobile device
steps.expectedResult: Login page is fully responsive on mobile, all form fields are accessible, login is successful, and schedule interface loads within 3 seconds

steps.action: Verify the mobile layout is optimized for small screens with stacked or collapsed elements, large touch targets, and readable text without zooming
steps.expectedResult: Layout is single-column or optimized for narrow screens, schedule displays in mobile-friendly format (list view or simplified grid), navigation controls are large enough for touch (minimum 44x44px), filters may be in a collapsible menu or drawer, text is readable without pinch-to-zoom (minimum 16px font), and no content is cut off or requires horizontal scrolling

steps.action: Test navigation between different screen orientations on mobile (portrait and landscape)
steps.expectedResult: Layout adjusts smoothly when rotating device, all features remain accessible in both orientations, and no layout breaks occur

steps.action: Verify page load time on mobile device or simulated mobile network
steps.expectedResult: Schedule interface loads within 3 seconds on mobile network, and performance meets defined SLAs

postconditions: Employee can successfully log out from any device
No layout breaks or errors are present
Interface remains functional across all tested screen sizes
Session is maintained appropriately
No console errors are logged

testCases.title: Test touch interaction on mobile devices
preconditions: Employee is logged into the schedule interface on a mobile device (iOS or Android)
Schedule data is available and displayed
Mobile device has touch screen capability
Internet connection is stable
Mobile browser is updated to latest version

steps.action: Verify the schedule interface is loaded and displayed on the mobile device
steps.expectedResult: Schedule interface is fully loaded and visible on mobile screen

steps.action: Tap on the 'Next Day' navigation button using finger touch
steps.expectedResult: Button responds immediately to touch, visual feedback is provided (button press animation or color change), schedule updates to next day within 2 seconds, and no delay or unresponsiveness occurs

steps.action: Tap on the 'Previous Day' navigation button
steps.expectedResult: Button responds to touch with visual feedback, schedule updates to previous day smoothly, and navigation works without errors

steps.action: Tap on the 'Next Week' navigation button
steps.expectedResult: Touch is registered correctly, schedule advances to next week, and transition is smooth without lag

steps.action: Tap on the 'Previous Week' navigation button
steps.expectedResult: Touch interaction works correctly, schedule updates to previous week, and no errors occur

steps.action: Tap on a specific shift entry in the schedule
steps.expectedResult: Shift is selected or details are displayed, touch target is large enough to tap accurately, and appropriate action occurs (details popup, highlight, or navigation)

steps.action: If filters are available, tap on the filter button or icon
steps.expectedResult: Filter menu or drawer opens smoothly, touch is registered accurately, and filter options are displayed

steps.action: Tap to select a filter option (e.g., shift type)
steps.expectedResult: Filter option is selected with visual confirmation, schedule updates to show filtered results, and touch interaction is smooth

steps.action: Perform a swipe gesture left or right on the schedule (if swipe navigation is supported)
steps.expectedResult: Swipe gesture is recognized, schedule navigates to previous or next period based on swipe direction, and gesture is smooth without accidental selections

steps.action: Perform a vertical scroll gesture to view more schedule entries
steps.expectedResult: Scrolling is smooth and responsive, content scrolls without lag, and no accidental taps occur during scrolling

steps.action: Tap on any dropdown menus or selection controls
steps.expectedResult: Dropdowns open correctly, options are touch-friendly and easy to select, and selections register accurately

steps.action: Rapidly tap on navigation buttons multiple times
steps.expectedResult: System handles rapid taps gracefully without errors, no duplicate actions occur, and interface remains responsive

steps.action: Test touch interactions with different finger sizes or using thumb
steps.expectedResult: All touch targets are accessible and usable regardless of finger size, minimum touch target size of 44x44px is maintained, and no accidental adjacent element selections occur

postconditions: Employee remains logged in
Schedule interface remains functional
No touch interaction errors are present
All navigation and selection states are correctly maintained
Mobile device performance is not degraded
No JavaScript errors are logged in console

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view detailed shift information to understand my work assignments fully

Employee has at least one shift assigned in the schedule
Schedule view is accessible and loaded
Test shift data includes role, location, notes, and status information

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule view page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view page loads successfully displaying the employee's shifts

steps.action: Identify a shift in the schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Shift is visible with basic information (date, time)

steps.action: Click or select the shift to view detailed information
steps.expectedResult: Detailed shift information panel or modal opens displaying comprehensive shift details

steps.action: Verify that the role field is displayed in the detailed information
steps.expectedResult: Role field is visible and shows the assigned role (e.g., 'Cashier', 'Manager')

steps.action: Verify that the location field is displayed in the detailed information
steps.expectedResult: Location field is visible and shows the work location (e.g., 'Store #123', 'Downtown Branch')

steps.action: Verify that special instructions or notes are displayed
steps.expectedResult: Notes section is visible showing any special instructions or additional information for the shift

steps.expectedResult: Shift status indicator is clearly visible (e.g., badge, icon, or color coding)

testCases.title: Verify access control for detailed shift data
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule view page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view page loads successfully

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to refresh my schedule view to see the latest updates and changes

testCases.title: Validate manual schedule refresh
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Schedule view is loaded and displaying current schedule data
Refresh button is visible and enabled on the schedule view
API endpoint GET /api/schedules is functional and accessible
Test data includes schedule changes that can be detected after refresh

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule view page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view page loads successfully displaying the employee's current schedule

steps.action: Note the current schedule data displayed (shifts, times, dates)
steps.expectedResult: Current schedule information is visible and documented for comparison

steps.action: Locate the refresh button on the schedule view interface
steps.expectedResult: Refresh button is visible and clearly identifiable (e.g., refresh icon or 'Refresh' label)

steps.action: Click the refresh button
steps.expectedResult: Loading indicator appears immediately (e.g., spinner, progress bar, or loading message)

steps.action: Observe the loading indicator during the refresh operation
steps.expectedResult: Loading indicator is visible and provides clear feedback that refresh is in progress

steps.action: Wait for the refresh operation to complete
steps.expectedResult: Loading indicator disappears and schedule view updates with the latest data within 2 seconds

steps.action: Compare the updated schedule with the previously noted schedule data
steps.expectedResult: Schedule reflects any recent changes made to shifts (new shifts, modified times, cancellations, etc.)

steps.action: Verify that all schedule elements are properly rendered after refresh
steps.expectedResult: All shifts, dates, times, and details are displayed correctly without visual glitches or missing data

postconditions: Schedule view displays the most current data from the database
Loading indicator is no longer visible
Refresh button remains enabled for subsequent refreshes
Employee can continue interacting with the updated schedule

testCases.title: Test refresh error handling
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Schedule view is loaded and displaying current schedule data
Ability to simulate API failure or network error exists (test environment or mock setup)
Previous schedule data is visible before refresh attempt

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule view page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view page loads successfully displaying the employee's current schedule

steps.action: Note the current schedule data displayed on the screen
steps.expectedResult: Current schedule information is visible and documented

steps.action: Simulate an API failure condition (e.g., disconnect network, configure mock API to return error, or use test tools to block the request)
steps.expectedResult: API failure condition is successfully simulated and ready to trigger on next request

steps.action: Click the refresh button on the schedule view
steps.expectedResult: System attempts to fetch latest schedule data and encounters the simulated API failure

steps.action: Observe the system response to the API failure
steps.expectedResult: Error message is displayed to the user indicating that the refresh failed (e.g., 'Unable to refresh schedule', 'Connection error', 'Please try again later')

steps.action: Verify that the error message is clear and user-friendly
steps.expectedResult: Error message provides meaningful information without exposing technical details or stack traces

steps.action: Check that the previous schedule data is still visible on the screen
steps.expectedResult: Previous schedule remains displayed and accessible; no data loss or blank screen occurs

steps.action: Verify that the schedule view remains functional after the error
steps.expectedResult: Employee can still interact with the existing schedule data and attempt another refresh if desired

postconditions: Previous schedule data remains intact and visible
Error message is displayed appropriately
System remains stable and responsive
Employee can retry the refresh operation when ready
